intro: Hieracium calodon subsp. strictiramum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its subspecies status highlights subtle morphological differences from other members of the *Hieracium* genus.
